１

チャート

4つのスライスを持つ円グラフ。
インタラクティブチャートの終了。
1回目の試み
問題1:
未回答

製造ワークフローを Google Cloud に移行すると、かなりの数のスタッフが Google Cloud Console にアクセスする必要が生じます。アクセス制御部門は、既存のActive DirectoryまたはLDAPサーバを現在のSSOソリューションとともに引き続き使用することを希望します。

どのようなアクションを取る必要がありますか?

説明

この質問では、既存の ID 管理システムと Google Cloud サービスの統合について説明します。具体的には、シングル サインオン(SSO)機能に加えて、現在の Active Directory または LDAP を使用して、スタッフに Google Cloud Console へのアクセスを提供する方法について説明します。


重要な用語:

  • Google Cloud Directory Sync: 既存の Active Directory または LDAP サーバーのユーザー アカウントを Google Cloud Identity サービスと同期し、ユーザー管理を一元化するサービス。

  • SSO(シングルサインオン):ユーザーが1組のログイン認証情報で複数のアプリケーションにアクセスできるようにする認証プロセスで、ユーザーエクスペリエンスとセキュリティを向上させます。

  • Active Directory (AD): Microsoft が Windows ドメイン ネットワーク用に開発したディレクトリ サービス。これは、ユーザーと ID の管理に広く使用されています。

  • LDAP(Lightweight Directory Access Protocol):インターネットプロトコルネットワークを介して分散ディレクトリ情報サービスにアクセスし、維持するための、ベンダーに依存しないオープンなアプリケーションプロトコル。

  • Kerberos: 秘密鍵暗号方式を使用して、クライアント/サーバー・アプリケーションに強力な認証を提供するように設計されたネットワーク認証プロトコル。

正解解説:

(オプション)

・Google Cloud Directory Syncを使用して、Googleドメイン内のユーザーデータベースを現在のActive DirectoryまたはLDAPサーバーと同期します。

この選択は、既存のユーザー管理システムを Google Cloud サービスと統合する場合に最適です。Google Cloud Directory Sync(GCDS)を使用すると、オンプレミスの Active Directory または LDAP サーバーと Google Cloud ユーザー アカウント間の同期プロセスを自動化できます。つまり、ユーザーが AD や LDAP に追加、変更、削除されると、これらの変更が Google Cloud ID サービスに自動的に反映され、手動による介入なしに既存の SSO エクスペリエンスを維持できます。


不正解の説明:

オプション: Google ドメイン内のユーザー データベースを手動で更新して、現在の Active Directory または LDAP サーバーに合わせて調整します。

この選択が間違っている理由は、Active Directory や LDAP で変更が発生したときに Google ドメインの各ユーザーを手動で更新するのはスケーラブルでも効率的でもないからです。手間がかかり、エラーが発生しやすく、リアルタイムの同期を提供できません。


オプション: 社内の Kerberos 互換 ID 管理システムの認証情報を使用して、ユーザーに Google Cloud Console に直接ログインしてもらいます。

The reason this choice is incorrect is that it misinterprets the integration capabilities of Google Cloud Console. Google Cloud does not offer direct login using Kerberos credentials without an intermediary service or Identity Provider (IdP) to translate these into a Google-recognized authentication token.


Option: Authenticate users with an OpenID (OIDC) compatible Identity Provider (IdP), obtain an authentication token, then use this token for accessing Google Cloud Console.

The reason this choice is incorrect is that while OpenID Connect is supported by Google Cloud, it doesn't align with the organization’s preference to continue using the existing Active Directory or LDAP server alongside the current SSO solution.


Reference:

  • https://cloud.google.com/solutions/federating-Google Cloud-with-active-directory-integrating

  • https://cloud.google.com/identity/docs/manage-resources

  • https://support.google.com/a/answer/106368?hl=en


問題2:
未回答

You manage a sensitive Cloud Spanner database that houses proprietary trade secrets, and you must ensure it cannot be reached from the public internet. To mitigate any risk of unauthorized data access, all database queries should be executable only by a set of predefined IP addresses.

What action should you take?

説明

This question evaluates the candidate's understanding of securing Google Cloud Platform resources, particularly Cloud Spanner, against unauthorized public access. The focus is on how to limit database queries to a set of predefined IP addresses.


Important Terms:

  • VPC Service Controls: A security layer for Google Cloud resources that allows you to define a security perimeter around data stored in GCP services to limit data exfiltration risks.

  • Access Level: Part of VPC Service Controls, Access Levels allow the configuration of attributes such as IP address ranges to enforce fine-grained access control to GCP resources.

Correct answer explanation:

(Option)

・Use VPC Service Controls and define an access level that includes the approved source IP address as the condition.

This choice is appropriate because VPC Service Controls enhance the security of sensitive data by restricting data access to a set of predefined IP addresses, thereby creating a secure perimeter around Cloud Spanner. By defining an access level that includes the condition of approved source IP addresses, you ensure that only clients from the specified IPs can execute database queries, aligning with the requirement to prevent access from the public internet.


Incorrect answer explanations:

Option: Configure Google Cloud Armor security policies to include an approved list of IPs at the HTTP(S) load balancer level.

The reason this choice is incorrect is that Cloud Armor is designed to protect against attacks at the HTTP(S) load balancer level, such as DDoS attacks or SQL injection. It does not provide a method to restrict access to Cloud Spanner databases based on source IP addresses.


Option: Implement the Restrict Resource Locations organization policy constraint in conjunction with Cloud Data Loss Prevention (DLP) tools.

The reason this choice is incorrect is that the Restrict Resource Locations organization policy and Cloud DLP are not tools for controlling access based on IP address. They are aimed at controlling the locations of stored data and protecting sensitive information, not for IP-based access management.


Option: Apply the Disable Service Usage organization policy constraint and utilize Cloud Data Loss Prevention (DLP) for additional control.

The reason this choice is incorrect is that applying the Disable Service Usage organization policy constraint prevents services from being used altogether and does not control access based on IP address. While Cloud DLP provides data protection, it does not restrict database query execution by IP address.


Reference:

  • https://cloud.google.com/vpc-service-controls/docs/create-manage-service-perimeters

  • https://cloud.google.com/access-context-manager/docs/overview

  • https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/controlled-access


問題3:
未回答

Your company relies on Google Workspace Enterprise Edition for user authentication and is implementing new security measures. There is a risk that staff members might leave their desktop computers unlocked after logging into Google Cloud, which could lead to unauthorized individuals making changes to the configurations.

How can you mitigate this risk?

説明

This question evaluates the understanding of Google Cloud's security practices concerning idle session management. It focuses on enhancing security to prevent unauthorized access due to unattended and unlocked desktop computers that are logged into Google Cloud.


Important Terms:

  • Session Duration: The amount of time a session remains active without requiring re-authentication. Adjusting session duration can forcefully log users out after periods of inactivity, enhancing security.

  • Google Workspace Enterprise Edition: A premium offering from Google that provides advanced features for businesses including enterprise-grade access and identity management solutions.

Correct answer explanation:

(Option)

・Adjust the session duration settings for Google Cloud services to expire more quickly.

This choice is the most direct and effective method to mitigate risk when computers are left unlocked. Adjusting session duration settings directly impacts how long a session remains active when a user is logged into Google Cloud. By setting these to expire more quickly, the window of opportunity for unauthorized individuals to access cloud services is reduced. This proactive approach does not rely on user behavior and enforces security at the technical level.


Incorrect answer explanations:

Option: Implement a guideline urging employees to always close their sessions if they will be away from their computers for an extended time.

The reason this choice is incorrect is that it relies on user compliance, which can be inconsistent. Guidelines are not enforceable by technical means and therefore provide inadequate protection against the risk of unauthorized access from unlocked computers.


Option: Conduct an audit to remove any non-essential Google Cloud APIs that are enabled.

The reason this choice is incorrect is that while auditing and removing non-essential APIs can limit the attack surface, it does not address the immediate risk of unauthorized access due to idle sessions on unlocked computers. Moreover, API management is unrelated to user session control.


Option: Enforce the use of complex passwords and two-step verification using hardware security keys or the Google Authenticator app.

The reason this choice is incorrect is that while using complex passwords and two-step verification significantly strengthens the authentication process, they do not prevent unauthorized access from an already authenticated session left unattended. These measures do not mitigate risks associated with unlocked desktops post authentication.


Reference:

  • https://cloud.google.com/docs/enterprise/best-practices-for-enterprise-organizations#set-session-lengths

  • https://cloud.google.com/identity/docs/how-to/setup-security-keys

  • https://support.google.com/a/answer/7576830?hl=en


問題4:
未回答

As a Cloud Identity administrator for a manufacturing company, you oversee managing user access for different manufacturing applications within your Google Cloud environment. Each machine at the manufacturing facility has a corresponding group to control access to its software systems. You are tasked with creating these groups, whereas the machinery management teams are in charge of adding or removing their team members using the Google Cloud console. Your objective is to ensure that the machinery teams can only include members who are part of the manufacturing company in their respective groups.

What action should you take?

説明

This question examines the candidate's understanding of managing group access within Google Cloud, specifically for internal company use. It evaluates the ability to restrict group membership to only users within the organization and requires knowledge of the correct tool and method for implementing this restriction.


Important Terms:

  • Google Workspace Admin Console: An administrative interface that allows the management of Google Workspace services, such as managing user accounts, groups, organizational units, and security settings related to Google Workspace applications.

Correct answer explanation:

(Option)

・Modify the settings of the specific groups in the Google Workspace Admin console to disallow external entities from being included in the groups.

This choice is the most direct and administratively sound approach. The Google Workspace Admin console permits administrators to configure group properties, including membership restrictions. Adjusting the settings here ensures that groups tied to the machinery can only be occupied by internal company users. This prevents external entities from joining, offering a scalable and manageable solution without manual intervention or complex IAM policy creation.


Incorrect answer explanations:

Option: Implement an Identity and Access Management (IAM) policy featuring a clause that limits group membership exclusively to user entities within the company.

The reason this choice is incorrect is that IAM policies are designed to manage permissions for Google Cloud resources rather than to directly govern the composition of user groups within Google Workspace. IAM policies do not have clauses specifically tailored for restricting group membership to internal users.


Option: Establish an Identity and Access Management (IAM) deny policy that rejects the attachment of entities outside the company to the specific groups.

The reason this choice is incorrect is that IAM deny policies prohibit certain actions on Google Cloud resources. However, they do not directly control group membership within Google Workspace, nor can they enforce membership restrictions based on user attributes, such as being part of the company.


Option: Export the Cloud Identity event data to BigQuery, then set up a notification for when external entities are injected into groups. When triggered, the notification should prompt a Cloud Function that excises the external entities from the group.

The reason this choice is incorrect is that it addresses the problem reactively and involves unnecessary complexity. Monitoring event data in BigQuery and triggering a Cloud Function may be practical for auditing, but it does not proactively prevent the inclusion of external entities and results in a delayed response.


Reference:

  • https://cloud.google.com/identity/docs/how-to/setup#creating-groups-for-your-organization

  • https://cloud.google.com/identity/docs/managing-groups

  • https://support.google.com/a/answer/167097?hl=en


問題5:
未回答

Your company's latest venture in renewable energy has led to the acquisition of several solar farm projects. Your Manager has tasked you with facilitating the transfer of Google Cloud projects related to these new assets into your company's existing organization node.

What are the critical preliminary actions to be taken before moving the projects? (Choose two.)

説明

This question examines the key preparatory actions to take before relocating Google Cloud projects into an existing organizational structure, focusing on securing access and ensuring network settings are adjusted.


Important Terms:

  • VPC Service Controls: A security feature that allows enterprises to set up a secure perimeter around Google Cloud resources to mitigate data exfiltration risks.

  • Organization Node: The root node in the Google Cloud resource hierarchy that represents an organization and manages policies including IAM and resource constraints at a global level.

  • IAM Policies: Defines who (identity) has what access (roles) to a particular Google Cloud resource. It is crucial for security and proper access management.

Correct answer explanation:

(Option)

・Review existing Identity and Access Management (IAM) policies on the projects slated for relocation.

・Exclude the designated projects from current VPC Service Controls perimeters prior to their transfer.

The choices correctly identify two necessary preliminary steps for the project transfer process. Reviewing IAM policies is essential for understanding who currently has access to the projects and what permissions they hold, thus avoiding undesired permission inheritance post-transfer. Excluding the projects from the VPC Service Controls perimeters is necessary to avoid network connectivity issues, as these controls may not be compatible with the new organizational structure and could prevent proper resource access or operations after the move.


Incorrect answer explanations:

Option: Eradicate all project-level bespoke Identity and Access Management (IAM) roles.

The reason this choice is incorrect is that it misinterprets the precautions necessary for project transfer. While ensuring proper IAM roles is crucial, there's no requirement to remove all custom roles unless they pose specific conflicts post-transfer.


Option: Block the propagation of organization policies to the projects scheduled for migration.

The reason this choice is incorrect is that blocking policy propagation would hinder the governance consistency that organization policies bring. Proper policy management should ensure policies are adapted for the projects, not blocked.


Option: Generate a fresh folder to house all projects targeted for the transition.

The reason this choice is incorrect is that simply creating a new folder would not address the necessary security or configuration audits required for the transfer. A folder structure should align with organizational resource management strategies, not act as a standalone solution for transition.


Reference:

  • https://cloud.google.com/resource-manager/docs/project-migration

  • https://cloud.google.com/iam/docs/understanding-roles

  • https://cloud.google.com/vpc-service-controls/docs/perimeters


問題6:
未回答

Your e-commerce company has been experiencing an uptick in fraudulent transactions from hijacked customer accounts. You want to deploy a Google 2-Step Verification (2SV) method that leverages a cryptographic token to authenticate users and confirms the legitimacy of the transaction portal URL.

Which Google 2SV method is appropriate for this use case?

説明

This question evaluates the understanding of advanced user authentication methods for securing e-commerce transactions by leveraging Google's 2-Step Verification options. It is focused on identifying the technology that uses a cryptographic token and ensures URL verification.


Important Terms:

  • Phishing-resistant 2FA: Authentication method designed to resist phishing attacks. It typically involves hardware tokens that can verify the legitimacy of the website a user is logging into.

  • Cryptographic Token: A hardware device used for securing account access by generating encrypted authentication codes that can validate user identity.

  • U2F (Universal 2nd Factor): An open authentication standard that strengthens and simplifies two-factor authentication using specialized USB or NFC devices.

Correct answer explanation:

(Option)

・Titan Security Keys

Titan Security Keys are designed as a phishing-resistant two-factor authentication (2FA) method. They incorporate Universal 2nd Factor (U2F) technology, which lets users authenticate to a website without getting tricked by phishing sites, as the cryptographic challenge cannot be verified by a fraudulent site. These keys protect against account takeovers by verifying the integrity of the login page URL and only communicating with the genuine host serving it.


Incorrect answer explanations:

Option: Google prompt

The reason this choice is incorrect is that Google prompt is intended as a 2SV method via a mobile device, providing a simple Yes/No prompt for authentication. It does not leverage a cryptographic token for user authentication or website URL verification.


Option: Google Authenticator app

The reason this choice is incorrect is that while the Google Authenticator app generates time-based one-time passwords (TOTPs) for 2SV, it does not use cryptographic tokens to authenticate users nor does it confirm the legitimacy of transaction portal URLs.


Option: Cloud HSM keys

The reason this choice is incorrect is that Cloud HSM keys are used to protect cryptographic keys in a cloud-based hardware security module. They do not act as user authentication devices for 2SV, nor do they offer website URL verification.


Reference:

  • https://cloud.google.com/identity-platform/docs/web/2fa

  • https://cloud.google.com/iam/docs/using-2-step-verification

  • https://support.google.com/a/answer/9176657?hl=en


問題7:
未回答

You are tasked with establishing a Cloud Interconnect link between your corporation's onsite network and a Google Cloud host project. You need to ensure that internal tools can interact exclusively with Google services via Cloud Interconnect without passing through the public internet. It's imperative to utilize only the APIs compatible with VPC Service Controls to minimize the risk of data leakage through APIs that are not supported.

What is the appropriate method to set up the network?

説明

This question focuses on configuring Google Cloud's network infrastructure to secure interactions between on-premises networks and Google services. It emphasizes the exclusive use of internal routes and APIs that adhere to VPC Service Controls to avoid data exposure over the public internet.


Important Terms:

  • Cloud Interconnect: A Google Cloud service for extending an organization’s private network to Google Cloud infrastructure, thereby allowing for private, reliable, and low-latency connections.

  • VPC Service Controls: Google Cloud's mechanism that provides security perimeters around resources of services to mitigate the risk of data exfiltration. It ensures that the data is not accessible by unauthorized services or users.

  • Restricted googleapis.com: A private endpoint for Google APIs that is only reachable from within Google Cloud networks or through peering, preventing access from the public internet.

Correct answer explanation:

(Option)

・Utilize the restricted version of googleapis.com to access Google services through an IP range that's only navigable internally within Google Cloud, which is then propagated as routes across the Cloud Interconnect.

This choice is correct because utilizing the restricted version of googleapis.com allows access to Google services exclusively through internal routes within Google Cloud. This setup ensures that communications between the on-premises network and Google services occur over a private connection, leveraging Cloud Interconnect. This configuration is fully compatible with VPC Service Controls, preventing data leakage by securing API access and routes only within the internal Google network.


Incorrect answer explanations:

Option: Turn on Private Google Access for subnetworks in every region and adopt a universal dynamic routing setting.

The reason this choice is incorrect is that simply enabling Private Google Access for subnetworks does not enforce the use of VPC Service Controls or guarantee that traffic to Google APIs will not travel over the public internet.


Option: Generate a CNAME record for redirecting *.googleapis.com to the restricted scope of googleapis.com, and configure A records that point to restricted.googleapis.com with an IP block of 199.36.153.4/30.

The reason this choice is incorrect is that creating a CNAME record and configuring A records with a specific IP block does not ensure that traffic will stay internal to Google Cloud and could expose APIs to the public internet, violating the requirement to use only VPC Service Controls supported APIs.


Option: Employ private access to googleapis.com services using an internally routable set of IP addresses within Google Cloud, which are then broadcasted as routes across the Interconnect link.

The reason this choice is incorrect is that while it employs private access, the method does not strictly leverage the restricted googleapis.com endpoint, which could allow access through non-supported APIs and potentially expose data.


Reference:

  • https://cloud.google.com/interconnect/docs

  • https://cloud.google.com/vpc-service-controls/docs

  • https://cloud.google.com/vpc/docs/configure-private-google-access#restricted-google-access


問題8:
未回答

A healthcare provider is transitioning their electronic health record system to Google Cloud, while keeping some essential services hosted in their local data center. They need to ensure at least a 70 Gbps connection for seamless data transfer.

What Google Cloud service should they use to maintain high-speed, secure connectivity between their on-premises infrastructure and the cloud?

説明

This question gauges the understanding of services available on Google Cloud to ensure high-speed, secure, and direct connectivity for transferring large volumes of data between on-premises infrastructure and Google Cloud.


Important Terms:

  • Dedicated Interconnect: Provides a direct physical connection between an organization's network and Google's network, offering highly available and low latency connections.

  • Cloud Router: Works with VPNs to dynamically exchange routes between your Google Cloud VPC and on-premises networks by using Border Gateway Protocol (BGP).

  • Cloud VPN: Establishes a secure and encrypted connection over the public internet between an on-premises network and your Google Cloud VPC.

  • Partner Interconnect: Offers connectivity to Google Cloud through a supported service provider, suitable for organizations requiring less capacity than Dedicated Interconnect.

Correct answer explanation:

(Option)

・Dedicated Interconnect

Dedicated Interconnect is the correct choice as it allows organizations to establish a direct physical connection between their on-premises network and Google's network, enabling transfer speeds of up to 100 Gbps per link. This is ideal for a healthcare provider needing a guaranteed 70 Gbps connection for the electronic health record system. Additionally, it offers a secure and private connection with consistent and low latency, which is crucial for sensitive health data.


Incorrect answer explanations:

Option: Cloud Router

The reason Cloud Router is incorrect is because it doesn't provide a connectivity solution by itself. Cloud Router is for dynamic routing for VPN connections and doesn’t offer dedicated bandwidth or the high throughput required for the scenario.


Option: Cloud VPN

The reason Cloud VPN is incorrect is because it provides encrypted tunnels over the internet with a maximum throughput of 3 Gbps per tunnel, which is insufficient for the 70 Gbps requirement stated in the question.


Option: Partner Interconnect

The reason Partner Interconnect is incorrect is because while it can be an option for extending an on-premises network to Google Cloud, it's typically chosen when Dedicated Interconnect’s capacity is too high. For the required 70 Gbps, Partner Interconnect throughput might not be sufficient or cost-effective.


Reference:

  • https://cloud.google.com/interconnect/docs/how-to/dedicated

  • https://cloud.google.com/network-connectivity/docs/vpn/concepts/overview

  • https://cloud.google.com/interconnect/docs/concepts/overview


問題9:
未回答

You are in the process of setting up Security Command Center for your company's Google Cloud infrastructure. Your security personnel requires notification when irregular virtual machines activities suggest unauthorized cryptocurrency mining and when there are prevalent misconfigurations in your Google Cloud resources that could impact security posture.

Which two features of Security Command Center should you employ to establish these notifications?

説明

This question assesses the ability to select appropriate features of Google Cloud's Security Command Center for specific security monitoring needs, focusing on unauthorized activities and misconfigurations that could affect security posture.


Important Terms:

  • Event Threat Detection: This fully managed service helps detect threats within the cloud logs automatically. It identifies unusual and potentially harmful activity, such as the deployment of malicious software or abusive behavior.

  • Security Health Analytics: This automated security assessment service provides visibility into potential vulnerabilities and threats in your Google Cloud resources, offering recommendations for improving security posture.

Correct answer explanation:

(Option)

・Event Threat Detection

・Security Health Analytics

Event Threat Detection is suitable for identifying patterns indicative of unauthorized cryptocurrency mining due to its capacity to analyze log data for suspicious activities. Security Health Analytics is adept in identifying, reviewing, and providing insights on common misconfigurations across Google Cloud resources that might affect the security posture. Together, these features facilitate comprehensive real-time security monitoring and notification, tailor-made for the scenarios described.


Incorrect answer explanations:

Option: Container Threat Detection

Container Threat Detection is focused on runtime security for containers, making it adept for observing suspicious activities within Google Kubernetes Engine and other containerized environments. It does not cater to broader virtual machine activities.


Option: Cloud Data Loss Prevention

Cloud Data Loss Prevention provides tools to discover, classify, and protect sensitive data. While vital for security, it does not directly address the detection of unauthorized activities or misconfigured resources as required.


Option: Google Cloud Armor

Google Cloud Armor is primarily designed to provide network security, including DDoS attack mitigation and application defense. It does not have the functionality to notify about misconfigurations or directly detect unauthorized mining activities.


Reference:

  • https://cloud.google.com/security-command-center/docs/concepts-security-sources#threat_detection

  • https://cloud.google.com/security-command-center/docs/concepts-security-health-analytics

  • https://cloud.google.com/security-command-center/docs/how-to-notifications-and-alerts


問題10:
未回答

You are setting up an inventory tracking system hosted on Compute Engine for a retail company. The company's policy requires that system access logs be retained for 15 years and that data residency is confined within the Asia-Pacific region. You are looking for a storage solution that simplifies management and is economically viable.

What should you undertake?

説明

The question aims to identify a storage solution for system access logs with two specific requirements: a 15-year retention period and data residency confined to the Asia-Pacific region. The solution should integrate with Compute Engine instances and offer easy management and cost-effectiveness.


Important Terms:

  • Data Residency: Data residency refers to the physical or geographical location where data is stored. Certain regulations and corporate policies may dictate that data is stored within specific regions to meet compliance requirements.

  • Retention Policy: A retention policy is a set of rules that governs how long data should be preserved before it can be deleted. Compliance with legal and regulatory requirements often dictates these policies.

  • Economically Viable: When a solution is economically viable, it means it is cost-effective and does not impose undue financial burden over the time it is in use, considering both initial and ongoing expenses.

Correct answer explanation:

(Option)

・Create a Cloud Storage bucket to store your system access logs in the ASIA-EAST1 region. Adjust your system to push logs directly to the bucket to optimize the process.

This choice is optimal because it directly addresses both specified requirements. Creating a Cloud Storage bucket in the ASIA-EAST1 region ensures data residency compliance. Cloud Storage also allows customers to set object lifecycle policies but does not directly support a fixed retention period of 15 years. Instead, objects can be set with a custom retention policy or a lifecycle policy can be implemented to prevent deletion for the required duration. It also simplifies the management of the logs without requiring additional services, and can be more cost-effective compared to other intricate solutions.


Incorrect answer explanations:

Option: Utilize the Google Cloud's operations suite's Cloud Logging agent on your Compute Engine instances to export system access logs to a dedicated log bucket in the ASIA-EAST1 region, setting a bespoke retention policy of 15 years.

The reason this choice is incorrect is because the Cloud Logging agent within the Google Cloud's operations suite is generally used for real-time monitoring, logging, and diagnostics, rather than long-term storage of logs. Moreover, while it is possible to export logs to Cloud Storage and set a custom retention policy, this approach is more complex and may not be the most economically viable solution for long-term storage.


Option: Employ a Pub/Sub topic to relay your system access logs to a Cloud Storage bucket positioned in the ASIA-EAST1 region.

The reason this choice is incorrect is that using Pub/Sub introduces unnecessary complexity and potential additional cost for a task that can be accomplished without it. Pub/Sub is ideal for real-time message queuing and stream processing, not for straightforward log storage. This does not meet the requirement of simplifying management or ensuring economic viability.


Option: Set up a custom retention period of 15 years for your Google Cloud's operations suite log bucket based in the ASIA-EAST1 region.

The reason this choice is incorrect is because it assumes the use of Google Cloud's operations suite log bucket. While you can set up a custom retention period, using the operations suite log bucket may not be the most cost-effective solution for storing logs for a duration as long as 15 years, especially when compared to simpler storage options.


Reference:

  • https://cloud.google.com/storage/docs/creating-buckets

  • https://cloud.google.com/storage/docs/locations

  • https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/instances/create-start-instance


問題11:
未回答

Your healthcare organization is concerned about the excessive rights at the enterprise level and wants to reduce the number of users with elevated access.

Which two positions should your organization minimize to tighten security? (Choose two.)

説明

This question assesses the understanding of role-based access within the context of Google Cloud, specifically focusing on minimizing excessive rights centrally to enhance organizational security. The correct answer identifies the roles that, when minimized, would significantly reduce broad access and tighten security.


Important Terms:

  • Least Privilege Principle: A security concept that recommends giving a user account only those privileges which are essential to perform its intended function.

  • IAM Role: Defines a set of permissions to perform specific actions on Google Cloud resources that can be assigned to users, groups, or service accounts.

  • Organization Policy: The configuration of governance rules for an entire organization that guides the deployment and usage of Google Cloud resources.

  • Billing Account: An account linked to a Google Cloud project that defines who pays for the resources and Google Cloud services used by that project.

Correct answer explanation:

(Option)

・Organization Policy Administrator

・Billing Account Administrator

Reducing users with an 'Organization Policy Administrator' role will limit the number of individuals who can set policies that affect all resources in the organization, thus tightening security. Minimizing 'Billing Account Administrators' lessens the number of individuals capable of managing billing configuration and could prevent unauthorized or accidental changes to billing which could indirectly affect resource availability and the security posture.


Incorrect answer explanations:

Option: Network Administrator

The reason why 'Network Administrator' is an incorrect choice is because this role strictly manages network resources, which doesn't give the broad administrative rights at the organizational or billing levels that are at the heart of the question.


Option: Healthcare API Admin

The reason why 'Healthcare API Admin' is incorrect is because this role is specific to administering the Healthcare API and does not provide elevated access rights across the enterprise level.


Option: Organization Viewer

Choosing 'Organization Viewer' is incorrect as this role grants read-only access to resources within the organization. It does not allow for changes to policies or permissions and therefore reducing this role would not tighten security in a meaningful way.


Reference:

  • https://cloud.google.com/iam/docs/understanding-roles

  • https://cloud.google.com/resource-manager/docs/access-control-org

  • https://cloud.google.com/resource-manager/docs/quickstart-organizations


問題12:
未回答

Following an audit of network security practices, it was discovered that database administrators frequently leave their Google Cloud CLI sessions active overnight. To enhance the system's security against any unauthorized session hijacking, you need to ensure these sessions are terminated as quickly as possible.

How can you achieve this?

説明

This question assesses understanding of security best practices regarding session management in the Google Cloud CLI. It tests the candidate's ability to configure session settings to mitigate the risk of session hijacking by promptly terminating inactive sessions.


Important Terms:

  • Session Control: A feature in Google Cloud that defines how long a user session remains active. It can force reauthentication and terminate sessions based on configured time intervals.

  • Reauthentication Frequency: A security setting that requires users to confirm their identity again after a specified period. It is used to enhance security by reducing the session's exposure time to hijacking threats.

  • Organization Policy Constraints: These constraints provide centralized governance over resources by enforcing specific requirements across all projects and services within the scope of the policy.

Correct answer explanation:

(Option)

・Set the reauthentication frequency for the Google Cloud Session Control to one hour.

This choice aligns with security best practices by ensuring that cloud CLI sessions demand reauthentication after a relatively short period of inactivity. By setting the reauthentication frequency to one hour, sessions would require users to confirm their identity, thereby reducing the risk of unauthorized access if a session is left open overnight.


Incorrect answer explanations:

Option: Increase the session expiry time for the Google Cloud session control to 24 hours.

The reason this choice is incorrect is because increasing the session expiry time would extend the window during which an inactive session remains open, thereby increasing the vulnerability to session hijacking rather than reducing it.


Option: Update the organization policy constraint constraints/iam.allowServiceAccountCredentialLifetimeExtension to a duration of 24 hours.

The reason this is incorrect is because this policy constraint relates specifically to the extension of service account credentials' lifetime, which is not directly relevant to terminating inactive user CLI sessions promptly.


Option: Define the organization policy constraint constraints/iam.serviceAccountKeyMaxLifetime to a maximum of 24 hours and set inheritFromParent to false.

The reason this choice is incorrect is because it pertains to the maximum lifetime of service account keys and has no direct impact on active user CLI sessions or their prompt termination when left unattended.


Reference:

  • https://cloud.google.com/iam/docs/configuring-reauthentication

  • https://cloud.google.com/resource-manager/docs/organization-policy/org-policy-constraints

  • https://cloud.google.com/sdk/gcloud/reference/auth/login


問題13:
未回答

A client has a business intelligence application on Compute Engine that requires constrained access to external networks. The security team set up an egress firewall rule to block (priority 1000) all outbound connections to the internet.

However, the Compute Engine instances must now be able to access an external vendor's update service for critical patches.

What action should your team take?

説明

This question deals with the configuration of egress firewall rules in a Google Cloud Compute Engine environment where outbound connections are restricted. The scenario requires allowing selective access to an external service without compromising the intended security posture.


Important Terms:

  • Egress Firewall Rule: This is a network security policy that controls the outbound traffic from your network to the internet or other networks, based on defined rules regarding the destination addresses, ports, and protocols.

  • Priority (Firewall Rules): In firewall settings, priority determines the order in which rules are evaluated. Lower numeric values indicate higher precedence. Rules with the lowest priority number are evaluated first.

Correct answer explanation:

(Option)

・Create an egress firewall rule to allow traffic to the IP range of the update service with a priority lower than 1000.

This choice is correct because creating an egress firewall rule with a lower priority number (higher precedence) than the existing block rule (priority 1000) ensures that traffic to the specific IP range of the update service is allowed before the rule that blocks all outbound traffic is evaluated. This way, only the necessary traffic to receive critical patches from the update service can pass through the firewall without opening access to all external networks.


Incorrect answer explanations:

Option: Create an egress firewall rule to allow traffic to the IP range of the update service with a priority higher than 1000.

The reason this choice is incorrect is that firewall rules with higher priority numbers are evaluated after those with lower numbers. Since there's already a block rule at priority 1000, a rule with a higher number would be evaluated later, and the block rule would take effect first, disallowing the necessary traffic.


Option: Create an egress firewall rule to allow traffic to the domain name of the update service with a priority higher than 1000.

The reason this choice is incorrect is two-fold: Firstly, it uses a priority higher than 1000, which would be overridden by the existing block rule, and secondly, Google Cloud firewall rules do not support domain names as targets, only IP ranges or tags.


Option: Create an egress firewall rule to allow traffic to the domain name of the update service with a priority lower than 1000.

This suggestion is incorrect because, while the priority is correctly set lower than 1000, Google Cloud firewall rules do not resolve domain names; rules must specify IP ranges or other recognized identifiers like tags or service accounts.


Reference:

  • https://cloud.google.com/vpc/docs/firewalls

  • https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/instances/connecting-advanced#firewallrules

  • https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/instances/managing-instance-access#configure_firewall_rules


問題14:
未回答

You need to ensure that your organization's Cloud Bigtable instances are not accessible from the public internet. You wish to enforce this across all Cloud Bigtable instances.

What action should you take?

説明

This question tests a learner's understanding of securing Cloud Bigtable instances to prevent access from the public internet by implementing appropriate access control and organization policies within Google Cloud Platform (GCP).


Important Terms:

  • Owner roles: Owner roles on a GCP resource grant a wide array of permissions, including managerial control over the resource and the ability to set access policies.

  • Domain restricted sharing: This policy setting within the GCP's Resource Manager prevents resources from being shared with identities outside of the trusted organization domain.

  • Organization policy: An organizational policy is a configuration of restrictions that provides centralized control over GCP resources for a GCP organization.

Correct answer explanation:

(Option)

・Remove Owner roles from end users, and enforce domain restricted sharing in an organization policy.

This choice correctly identifies that restricting permissions and enforcing domain-level constraints are key to preventing unauthorized access. By removing Owner roles, users are deprived of the ability to change access controls that could expose Cloud Bigtable instances. Implementing domain restricted sharing, through an organization policy, limits resource accessibility to users within the organization, effectively blocking public internet access to resources like Cloud Bigtable.


Incorrect answer explanations:

Option: Remove Owner roles from end users, and set up Cloud Data Loss Prevention for Bigtable.

The reason this choice is incorrect is that while removing Owner roles restricts user permissions, setting up Cloud Data Loss Prevention (DLP) for Bigtable does not prevent access from the public internet. DLP mainly focuses on discovering and masking sensitive data.


Option: Enable uniform instance-level access, and enforce domain restricted sharing in an organization policy.

This option is incorrect because enabling uniform instance-level access does not inherently prevent access from the public internet but rather simplifies permission management and can be safer to use. However, this alone does not ensure that Bigtable instances are not publicly accessible.


Option: Remove *.setIamPolicy permissions from all roles, and enforce domain restricted sharing in an organization policy.

The reason this choice is incorrect is because removing *.setIamPolicy permissions would prevent modifying access controls, but does not enforce a domain restricted policy. This could lead to instances still being public if the existing policies are not properly secured.


Reference:

  • https://cloud.google.com/storage/docs/using-bucket-policies

  • https://cloud.google.com/resource-manager/docs/organization-policy/org-policy-constraints

  • https://cloud.google.com/iam/docs/understanding-roles


問題15:
未回答

You identify that confidential customer financial data is being transferred to your Google Cloud environment as part of the nightly ETL operations from a regional data center to your Cloud Spanner databases. You must anonymize this information to mask the customer details but need the ability to revert the masking for financial reporting.

Which components would be the most suitable for this requirement? (Select two.)

説明

This question examines the candidate's knowledge on securing sensitive data within the Google Cloud environment, specifically covering data anonymization while maintaining reversibility for reporting purposes. The focus is on selecting appropriate components to encrypt and manage access to sensitive information during ETL operations.


Important Terms:

  • Deterministic encryption: A form of encryption that produces the same encrypted text for a given piece of data each time. Especially useful in scenarios where encrypted data needs to match across different systems.

  • AES-SIV: Authenticated encryption mode that allows encryption to be deterministic, which means the same plaintext encrypted with the same key always produces the same ciphertext.

  • Data anonymization: The process of protecting private or sensitive information by erasing or encrypting identifiers that connect an individual to stored data.

Correct answer explanation:

(Option)

・Cloud Key Management Service

・Cloud Data Loss Prevention with deterministic encryption using AES-SIV

The combination of Cloud Key Management Service (KMS) and Cloud Data Loss Prevention (DLP) with deterministic encryption using AES-SIV is ideal for reversible anonymization of sensitive data. Cloud KMS allows for managing cryptographic keys that control access to data, enabling secure encryption and decryption operations. Using DLP with AES-SIV deterministic encryption means when data is encrypted, it can be matched with the same unique ciphertext consistently, allowing for specific data to be reversibly masked without losing its utility for financial reporting.


Incorrect answer explanations:

Option: Secret Manager

The reason Secret Manager is incorrect is that it is designed for storing and managing access to secrets, such as API keys and passwords, rather than providing a mechanism for data anonymization and encryption within ETL pipelines.


Option: Cloud Data Loss Prevention with cryptographic hashing

The reason Cloud Data Loss Prevention with cryptographic hashing is incorrect is because hashing is a one-way operation, not suitable for scenarios where data needs to be reversible for subsequent processing or reporting.


Option: Cloud Data Loss Prevention with automatic text redaction

The reason Cloud Data Loss Prevention with automatic text redaction is incorrect is because redaction permanently removes the data, prohibiting the ability to reconstruct the original content for financial reporting.


Reference:

  • https://cloud.google.com/kms

  • https://cloud.google.com/dlp/docs/concepts-deidentification#de-identification_in_the_dlp_api


問題16:
未回答

Your health data compliance team has adopted the method of crypto-shredding to remove sensitive patient health information (PHI). You are tasked with implementing this process within Google Cloud while leveraging most of the cloud offerings and minimizing the management burden.

How should you proceed?

説明

This question centers on the appropriate approach for the secure deletion of sensitive data in Google Cloud, specifically addressing the most efficient method of data destruction while ensuring compliance with health data regulation and minimizing operational overhead.


Important Terms:

  • Crypto-shredding: A security practice where encryption keys are destroyed to render associated data unreadable, effectively 'shredding' the data without deleting the actual data files.

  • Cloud Key Management Service (KMS): A cloud service that manages encryption keys, enabling centralized control over cryptographic operations and the secure deletion of keys.

Correct answer explanation:

(Option)

・Use Cloud Key Management Service (KMS) to destroy particular key versions.

This choice is the most apt as it utilizes Google Cloud's Key Management Service (KMS) to handle encryption keys. By destroying a specific key version in KMS, any data encrypted with that key becomes irretrievable. This process simplifies the management burden since KMS allows for centralized key management, including deletion, and is conducive with the crypto-shredding method as it outsources the key management to a managed service.


Incorrect answer explanations:

Option: Implement client-side encryption for your data before uploading it to Google Cloud, and manage key deletion in your own data centers.

The reason this choice is incorrect is because managing encryption and key deletion on-premises demands significant resources and doesn't harness the scalability and managed services of Google Cloud, which increases the operational burden contrary to the question's specification.


Option: Create and manage your own encryption keys using customer-managed encryption keys (CMEK) and destroy them as needed.

The reason this approach is flawed is that while you can use Customer-Managed Encryption Keys (CMEK) within Google Cloud, the complete management lifecycle of the keys, including secure destruction, will increase the overhead for the team beyond the desired goal of minimizing management burden.


Option: Rely on Google's automatic encryption to selectively annihilate encryption keys.

The reason this choice is incorrect is because Google’s automatic encryption does not provide the ability to selectively annihilate keys. Google manages the encryption and decryption transparently, and users do not have direct control over the keys to perform crypto-shredding.


Reference:

  • https://cloud.google.com/kms/docs/external-key-managers

  • https://cloud.google.com/kms/docs/crypto-shredding

  • https://cloud.google.com/security-key-management


問題17:
未回答

In line with your company's principles of least privilege, you use Identity-Aware Proxy (IAP) to secure several internal web services. You aim to import logs into an advanced Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) tool to be promptly notified of any unauthorized access attempts.

Which logs are essential for this security analysis?

説明

This question examines the candidate's understanding of the appropriate logs needed for security analysis using a Security Information and Event Management tool, while adhering to the principle of least privilege using Identity-Aware Proxy.


Important Terms:

  • Identity-Aware Proxy (IAP): A service that controls access to cloud applications running on Google Cloud by verifying a user's identity and determining if that user should be allowed to access the application.

  • Least Privilege: A security principle advocating that users and systems are granted the minimum levels of access – or permissions – needed to perform their tasks.

  • SIEM: Security Information and Event Management tools provide real-time analysis of security alerts and events across an organization's IT infrastructure.

  • Data Access audit logs: Records that track accesses to user-made content by Google Cloud services. Useful for auditing access patterns and understanding security incidents.

Correct answer explanation:

(Option)

・Data Access audit logs

This choice is appropriate because Data Access audit logs in Google Cloud Platform track API calls that create, modify, or read user-provided data. These logs are crucial for security analysis as they help to trace which user had access to what data at what time, enabling the detection of unauthorized access attempts. By feeding this information into an advanced SIEM tool, an organization can set up alerts and perform real-time security audits.


Incorrect answer explanations:

Option: Access Transparency logs

The reason this choice is incorrect is that Access Transparency logs provide insight into the actions Google employees take when accessing user content. This is less relevant for tracking unauthorized access attempts by external actors, which is the primary concern when monitoring for security threats.


Option: Compute Engine system event logs

The reason this choice is incorrect is because Compute Engine system event logs record events that affect the infrastructure supporting Compute Engine, rather than the access to user data or applications which is what the question is concerned with.


Option: System Event audit logs

The reason this choice is incorrect is that System Event audit logs typically refer to logs generated by actions that Google considers to be system events in Google Cloud services. These do not include data access events but rather administrative actions like changes to service configurations or metadata.


Reference:

  • https://cloud.google.com/iap/docs/audit-log-howto

  • https://cloud.google.com/logging/docs/audit

  • https://cloud.google.com/security-command-center/docs/how-to-use-security-sources#logging


問題18:
未回答

Your finance department handles sensitive transaction data and employs encryption keys to safeguard this information. You aim to develop a procedure to mitigate the effects of a potential breach of a symmetric encryption key within Cloud Key Management Service (Cloud KMS).

What measures should your department implement in advance of any security incidents? (Choose two.)

説明

This question evaluates the proactive strategies for managing encryption keys in Google Cloud's Key Management Service (KMS) in case of a security breach. It focuses on the best practices for key rotation and data encryption policy.


Important Terms:

  • Symmetric encryption: This type of encryption uses a single key for both the encryption and decryption processes. It is efficient for bulk data encryption but poses a risk if the key is compromised.

  • Key version rotation: The process of creating a new version of the encryption key while keeping the old versions available. Regular rotation can limit the amount of data exposed in the event of a key compromise.

  • Transactional data: Data that records the transactions of a business or any data-exchange entity. Ensuring its integrity and confidentiality is crucial to the entity's security posture.

Correct answer explanation:

(Option)

・Schedule regular automatic key version rotations.

・Restrict the amount of transactional data encrypted with a single key version.

The combination of scheduling regular automatic key version rotations and restricting the amount of transactional data encrypted with a single key version is aimed at minimizing the potential impact of compromised keys. The key rotation ensures that if a key is compromised, only the data encrypted with that specific key version could be affected, while limiting the data encrypted with a particular key version prevents extensive data exposure in case of a breach.


Incorrect answer explanations:

Option: Deactivate and revoke permissions for keys suspected of being compromised.

The reason deactivating and revoking permissions for compromised keys is incorrect, is that it is a reactive measure. The question asks for proactive strategies to be implemented beforehand to mitigate potential breaches.


Option: Occasionally rotate key versions based on unscheduled needs.

The reason occasionally rotating key versions based on unscheduled needs is incorrect, is because relying on ad-hoc rotations lacks a systematic approach. Regular, scheduled rotations are preferred for consistency and to ensure that keys are not left unchanged for extended periods.


Option: Turn off the Cloud KMS API.

The reason turning off the Cloud KMS API is incorrect is that this approach would prevent all access to the key management service, which could disrupt legitimate uses of encryption keys and not serve as a proactive measure for a specific key's potential compromise.


Reference:

  • https://cloud.google.com/kms/docs/rotating-keys

  • https://cloud.google.com/kms/docs/envelope-encryption

  • https://cloud.google.com/kms/docs/restricting-crypto-key-versions


問題19:
未回答

Your enterprise is leveraging Cloud Bigtable for its NoSQL database needs. You need a method to craft, cycle, and dismantle symmetric encryption keys for the SSDs utilized by Cloud Bigtable. The keys should be storable in the cloud.

What measures should you take?

説明

This question tests the candidate's knowledge of managing encryption keys for securing Cloud Bigtable SSDs. It focuses on understanding the appropriate service for creating and managing encryption keys that are stored and used in the cloud environment.


Important Terms:

  • Symmetric Encryption: A type of encryption where the same key is used for encrypting and decrypting data. It is essential for performance when encrypting data at rest.

  • Data Encryption Key (DEK): A key used to directly encrypt data, this is often encrypted with another key (a KEK) for additional security layers and key management convenience.

  • Key Encryption Key (KEK): A key that is used to encrypt, or wrap, other keys (such as DEKs) to enhance the security of key management processes.

  • Cloud Key Management Service (KMS): A cloud-based service that allows users to manage cryptographic keys for their cloud services in a secure and compliant way.

Correct answer explanation:

(Option)

・Use the Cloud Key Management Service to create and control the data encryption key (DEK).

This choice is appropriate as the Cloud Key Management Service (KMS) is a dedicated service for creating, using, and managing cryptographic keys in the cloud. Utilizing Cloud KMS allows you to generate and control the data encryption key (DEK) which can be used to encrypt the SSDs within Cloud Bigtable, and meet the requirement of storing keys in the cloud securely.


Incorrect answer explanations:

Option: Use the Cloud Key Management Service to create and control the key encryption key (KEK).

The reason this is incorrect is that managing the key encryption key (KEK) specifically does not directly answer the question of how to handle the encryption of data on SSDs used by Cloud Bigtable. KEKs are typically used to encrypt DEKs, rather than the data itself.


Option: Utilize customer-managed encryption keys to govern the data encryption key (DEK).

The reason this is incorrect is that customer-managed encryption keys imply that the customer is responsible for the generation and storage of the DEK. This contradicts the requirement that the keys must be storable in the cloud, which is facilitated by a service like Cloud KMS.


Option: Employ customer-managed encryption keys for the oversight of the key encryption key (KEK).

The reason this is incorrect is similar to the second choice. Customer-managed encryption keys for KEK oversight implies direct customer involvement in key generation and storage. This removes the efficiency and security that cloud-based key management services provide, like Cloud KMS.


Reference:

  • https://cloud.google.com/security-key-management

  • https://cloud.google.com/dataproc/docs/concepts/configuring-clusters/security

  • https://cloud.google.com/kms/docs/creating-keys


問題20:
未回答

In an effort to align with HIPAA regulations, a healthcare provider wants to confirm that every instance of data egress is validated.

Which two Google Cloud services fulfill this stipulation without the need for extra mitigating measures? (Select two.)

説明

This question evaluates the understanding of HIPAA-compliant services in Google Cloud, specifically regarding the validation of data egress. The learner must identify which services inherently offer HIPAA-aligned egress controls without additional safeguards.


Important Terms:

  • HIPAA Compliance: Refers to the set of standards established to protect sensitive patient health information from being disclosed without the patient's consent or knowledge.

  • Data Egress: The flow of data outward from a network, typically when transferring from internal storage to an external destination.

  • Egress Controls: Security measures implemented to monitor and potentially restrict the flow of information exiting a network boundary.

Correct answer explanation:

(Option)

・Compute Engine

・Google Kubernetes Engine

Compute Engine and Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) are designed to handle data egress in a manner that can support HIPAA-compliant workloads without requiring additional egress controls. GKE, as a managed service for container orchestration built upon Compute Engine, inherits the built-in security and compliance capabilities, including for data egress, which can help satisfy HIPAA requirements. Both services provide robust network security features, allowing organizations to configure firewalls and use private IPs, aiding in preventing unauthorized data access and transfer.


Incorrect answer explanations:

Option: App Engine

The reason App Engine is incorrect is because it is a Platform-as-a-Service offering, where the underlying network and security configurations are abstracted away from the user, potentially necessitating additional measures for HIPAA compliance.


Option: Cloud Functions

The reason Cloud Functions is incorrect is because it is a serverless execution environment, where the user has limited control over the network egress, and may require extra steps to comply with HIPAA's stringent egress control requirements.


Option: Cloud Storage

The reason Cloud Storage is incorrect is because this service focuses on data storage, and while it offers fine-grained access controls, it does not inherently validate data egress, which is required to be compliant with HIPAA regulations without extra layers of security.


Reference:

  • https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/vpc

  • https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/docs/concepts/network-overview

  • https://www.pcisecuritystandards.org/documents/PCI_DSS_v3-2-1.pdf


問題21:
未回答

Your health data analysis team is configuring a Shared VPC Network within the project med-vpc-central where it is the host project. The team has already set up the necessary firewall rules, subnets, and VPN gateway in the central project. They want to allow Research Department B to link a Compute Engine instance exclusively to the 10.2.2.0/24 subnet.

What permission should the team give to Research Department B to fulfill this condition?

説明

This question examines knowledge of organizing network resources in Google Cloud using Shared VPC. Specifically, it focuses on the permission required for the Research Department B to utilize a specific subnet for a Compute Engine instance within a host project's Shared VPC.


Important Terms:

  • Shared VPC: Allows an organization to connect resources from multiple projects to a common VPC network, enabling communication between them while keeping resource management centralized.

  • Compute Network User role: Provides permissions to create, modify, and use network resources, but does not permit management of the resources.

  • Role granularity: Defines the specificity level of permissions assignment in Google Cloud, which can be set at the organization, folder, project, or resource level.

Correct answer explanation:

(Option)

・Compute Network User Role at the subnet level.

This choice is appropriate because the Compute Network User role at the subnet level precisely provides the necessary permissions for users in Research Department B to link a Compute Engine instance to the 10.2.2.0/24 subnet without granting broader network-wide permissions that might affect other subnets or projects. It's especially suitable for restricting access to a particular resource within the Shared VPC, aligning with the principle of least privilege.


Incorrect answer explanations:

Option: Compute Network User Role at the host project level.

The reason this choice is incorrect is that assigning the Compute Network User role at the host project level grants permission across the whole project, not limiting the user to a specific subnet, which might lead to unintended access to other network resources.


Option: Compute Shared VPC Admin Role at the host project level.

The reason this choice is incorrect is that the Compute Shared VPC Admin role at the host project level provides extensive network administration privileges. This role may configure the Shared VPC and is overly permissive for just linking a single Compute Engine instance to a subnet.


Option: Compute Shared VPC Admin Role at the service project level.

This choice is incorrect because granting the Compute Shared VPC Admin role at the service project level is unnecessary for the task. This role would permit the management of Shared VPC settings and associated resources within the service project, which is not required for linking an instance to a single subnet.


Reference:

  • https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/shared-vpc

  • https://cloud.google.com/vpc/docs/provisioning-shared-vpc

  • https://cloud.google.com/iam/docs/understanding-roles#compute-engine-roles


問題22:
未回答

Your healthcare organization is transitioning to Google Cloud. You need to synchronize your medical staff records first by using Google Cloud Directory Sync (GCDS). Some of the medical staff have already established Google Cloud identities using their work email addresses independently of GCDS. You are required to consolidate your users into Cloud Identity.

What actions should you undertake?

説明

This question assesses the ability to consolidate user accounts in a Google Cloud environment efficiently. It focuses on the scenario where existing independently created Google Cloud accounts need to be merged with new accounts synchronized via Google Cloud Directory Sync (GCDS).


Important Terms:

  • Cloud Identity: A Google Cloud service for managing users, groups, and domains in a unified way across all Google Workspace services without the need for a dedicated on-premises directory server.

  • Google Cloud Directory Sync (GCDS): A tool that synchronizes user data from an Active Directory or LDAP server with Google Cloud Identity accounts to streamline the management of Google services in an enterprise environment.

  • Unmanaged Account: An account created outside of a company's domain control, often by an individual signing up for Google services with a work email before these services are officially provided by the company.

  • Admin SDK: A set of APIs that allows developers to perform administrative tasks in G Suite such as managing users, apps, and devices, often used in conjunction with Directory API for User management.

Correct answer explanation:

(Option)

・Utilize the account transfer tool to shift pre-existing unmanaged accounts.

This choice is appropriate because the Google Cloud account transfer tool is specifically designed to handle scenarios where employees have independently created accounts with their work emails. It allows administrators to claim these 'unmanaged' accounts and transfer their data to managed Google Cloud identities under the organization's control, facilitating a seamless user consolidation without the loss of data or interruption of services.


Incorrect answer explanations:

Option: Set up GCDS and utilize GCDS lookup rules to integrate these individual accounts.

The reason this choice is incorrect is because GCDS lookup rules are used to match existing user records in Active Directory or LDAP with Google Cloud identities. This does not address the concern of transferring the existing data from pre-existing unmanaged accounts into the organization's managed domain.


Option: Develop a custom automation to pinpoint current Google Cloud identities and employ the Admin SDK: Directory API to reassign their memberships.

The reason this choice is incorrect is because while a custom automation using the Admin SDK could technically find and change Google Cloud identities, it overlooks the built-in solution of the account transfer tool which is designed for this exact purpose. It would be unnecessarily complex and time-consuming.


Option: Initiate GCDS configuration and implement GCDS ignoring rules to prevent the accounts from becoming inactive.

The reason this choice is incorrect is that implementing GCDS ignoring rules to avoid the accounts becoming inactive does not facilitate the consolidation of unmanaged accounts with Cloud Identity. The ignoring rules simply bypass certain records during synchronization, which would not solve the consolidation requirement.


Reference:

  • https://cloud.google.com/identity/docs/transfer-tool

  • https://cloud.google.com/identity/docs/how-to/setup#setting_up_gcds

  • https://support.google.com/a/answer/1041297?hl=en


問題23:
未回答

Your company is looking to enhance security for all services running on Compute Engine instances to ensure they are shielded from boot-level and kernel-level malware. Additionally, you've been asked to make sure that the data being processed by the VMs is inaccessible to the physical infrastructure, through the use of a hardware-rooted solution.

What steps should you take?

説明

This question assesses knowledge on enhancing VM security against low-level threats and protecting sensitive in-use data leveraging unique GCP capabilities. It requires understanding hardware-rooted security mechanisms provided by GCP's advanced VM solutions.


Important Terms:

  • Shielded VMs: A service offering from Google Cloud that provides fortified virtual machines with features like secure boot, vTPM, and integrity monitoring to protect against rootkits and bootkits.

  • Confidential VMs: A breakthrough technology provided by Google Cloud that encrypts data in-use with a hardware-rooted solution, ensuring the data remains opaque to the infrastructure handling it.

  • Secure Boot: A security feature that prevents unauthorized software from booting on a system by verifying digital signatures of the boot components against known good signatures.

  • vTPM: Virtual Trusted Platform Module acts as a secure cryptoprocessor that enhances hardware security by facilitating secure generation of cryptographic keys.

  • Integrity Monitoring: A security capability that checks and reports the integrity of the systems to detect if they have been tampered with, especially useful against root-level compromises.

Correct answer explanation:

(Option)

・Utilize Shielded VMs from Google Cloud that come with features such as secure boot, a Virtual Trusted Platform Module (vTPM), and integrity monitoring capabilities. Additionally, implement Google Cloud's Confidential VMs to protect the data in use.

This choice is optimal as it leverages both Shielded VMs and Confidential VMs, covering both the need for boot-level security and data in-use protection. Shielded VMs safeguard against malware and ensure OS integrity via secure boot and vTPM. Confidential VMs complement this by encrypting data in-use, making it unreadable to the host infrastructure, even if the physical layers were compromised, thereby providing a comprehensive security position.


Incorrect answer explanations:

Option: Configure a Cloud Function to periodically evaluate the security settings of your Compute Engine VMs, create necessary metrics, and trigger this function on a regular schedule.

The reason this choice is incorrect is because Cloud Functions are serverless event-driven services focused on running code snippets, not providing hardware-level security. While they can help automate security checks, they cannot enforce kernel-level and hardware-rooted data encryption.


Option: Enable the Virtual Machine Threat Detection feature within the Security Command Center Premium tier and continuously assess the generated reports for any threats.

The reason this choice is incorrect is because the Security Command Center, while valuable for threat assessment and security monitoring, does not provide the kernel-level integrity guarantees or in-use data encryption that are accomplished by implementing Shielded and Confidential VMs.


Option: Select hardened virtual machine images provided by Google Cloud Marketplace, ensure the deployment process includes enabling the Confidential VM feature, and enforce the utilization of approved images along with Confidential VM setup through the use of organization policies.

The reason this choice is incorrect is that while hardened virtual machine images offer pre-configured security, enforcing Confidential VMs setup through organization policies does not inherently secure data in-use. It is necessary to utilize Google Cloud's Confidential VMs for hardware-rooted data protection.


Reference:

  • https://cloud.google.com/security/shielded-cloud/shielded-vm

  • https://cloud.google.com/confidential-computing

  • https://cloud.google.com/resource-manager/docs/organization-policy/organization-policy-introduction


問題24:
未回答

A network engineer observes unauthorized access attempts on their Cloud Load Balancer. The engineer aims to analyze the API calls that access configurations or metadata of the networking resources.

Which Google Cloud logs would be most helpful for the engineer to inspect?

説明

This question assesses the understanding of Google Cloud's logging capabilities, specifically around the type of logs that would record unauthorized access attempts and API calls that modify network configurations or access metadata.


Important Terms:

  • Data Access logs: Detailed audit logs within Google Cloud that record when data is created, modified, or accessed. Useful for forensic and compliance purposes, especially regarding unauthorized access investigations.

  • API calls: Requests made to API endpoints that execute operations, such as accessing, modifying, or managing resources within Google Cloud services.

Correct answer explanation:

(Option)

・Data Access logs

Data Access logs are detailed logs provided by Google Cloud that track API calls and access to user data. For a network engineer monitoring unauthorized access, these logs are instrumental as they contain records of read and write operations on network-configurations and metadata access. Analyzing Data Access logs would enable the engineer to review which API calls accessed or modified the configurations thereby offering insights into the unauthorized access patterns and potential security breaches.


Incorrect answer explanations:

Option: Admin Activity logs

The reason Admin Activity logs are not the most useful in this scenario is because they primarily track operations that modify the configuration or metadata of resources on the cloud. However, they do not provide detailed data access records which are needed for investigating unauthorized data accesses.


Option: System Event logs

The reason System Event logs are not the best choice is that they focus on system-generated events that affect the state, availability, or configuration of resources, rather than specific API calls that access or modify data or metadata.


Option: Access Transparency logs

The reason Access Transparency logs are inappropriate for this case is that they are designed to provide logs whenever Google personnel access user content, rather than unauthorized external access attempts or API call investigations performed by the users.


Reference:

  • https://cloud.google.com/logging/docs/audit

  • https://cloud.google.com/iam/docs/auditing

  • https://cloud.google.com/sql/docs/mysql/admin-api/logging


問題25:
未回答

Your healthcare data analysis team is tasked with setting up a Google Cloud network architecture to centralize the management of network resources, such as firewall configurations, network segments, and network pathways. They are also responsible for guaranteeing secure connectivity from on-site healthcare facilities to Google Cloud services using a dedicated private connection. The network administration team must maintain exclusive control over these network configurations.

Which networking solution should the healthcare data analysis team employ to satisfy these criteria?

説明

This question assesses the ability to design a secure and centrally managed network infrastructure within Google Cloud, particularly for handling sensitive healthcare data that requires a dedicated private connection and controlled network configuration.


Important Terms:

  • Shared VPC: Allows resources from multiple projects to connect to a common Virtual Private Cloud for centralized management, contributing to a more organized and secure network.

  • Host project: A component of Shared VPC that holds the shared network resources and is responsible for their management, while other projects, known as service projects, use these resources.

  • Service projects: In a Shared VPC setup, these are the individual projects that connect to the host project's network resources, enabling resource sharing and centralized control.

  • Dedicated private connection: Refers to solutions like Cloud Interconnect, which provide a direct, private network connection between on-premises networks and Google Cloud.

Correct answer explanation:

(Option)

・Shared VPC Network with a host project and service projects

This choice is optimal because a Shared VPC Network enables an organization to centrally manage networking resources such as subnets, routes, and firewalls. By utilizing a host project to manage shared resources and connect service projects, it ensures that the network administration team has exclusive control. This setup not only simplifies network management across multiple projects but also aligns with the need for secure connectivity and compliance with healthcare regulations.


Incorrect answer explanations:

Option: Assign the Compute Admin role to the security team within each healthcare project

The reason this choice is incorrect is that providing the Compute Admin role to the security team allows them to manage compute resources but does not address the requirements for centralized management or dedicated private connection for secure data transfer.


Option: Implement VPC peering across all healthcare projects in a decentralized topology

The reason this choice is incorrect is that VPC peering connects two VPC networks, maintaining resource segregation and decentralizing network management. It does not offer centralized control nor ensure a dedicated private connection as mandated for healthcare data.


Option: Set up individual Cloud VPN Gateways for each healthcare project in a decentralized topology

The reason this choice is incorrect is that setting up individual Cloud VPN Gateways for each project creates a decentralized network topology, which complicates network management and fails to meet the requirement for centralized control over network configurations.


Reference:

  • https://cloud.google.com/vpc/docs/shared-vpc

  • https://cloud.google.com/network-connectivity/docs/vpn/concepts/overview

  • https://cloud.google.com/iam/docs/understanding-roles#compute-engine-roles


問題26:
未回答

What are the steps to secure medical records using envelope encryption in a healthcare application hosted on Google Cloud?

説明
